attributes.action: All mortgages paid by Housing benefits for more than six months should be re-paid when owner sells  the property or dies.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people have had mortgages paid by Government for  years and end up with a house paid for by  people struggling a lifetime to pay their own.
The Government should take back, with interest the amount received by houseowner on their  death or re-sale of property .
The payments  should be treated as a loan.
